description: An advance contract award notice (ACAN) for a Traditional Healer Apprentice position within Correctional Service of Canada (CSC). The position is set to provide traditional healing services to Indigenous offenders. The selected provider must meet 5 years commitment, having firm support from the Nekaneet First Nation community.
full_summary:
**Traditional Healer Apprentice Tender**
[English text only]

**Overview:**
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) invites qualified suppliers to submit a statement of capabilities for the provision of a Traditional Healer Apprentice to support the spiritual and cultural needs of Indigenous offenders at Okimaw Ohci Healing Lodge and within the community of Nekaneet First Nation.

**Requirements:**

* Candidate must be recognized by their community as a Traditional Healer Apprentice.
* Candidate must be a member of the Nekaneet First Nation Band.
* Candidate must have a minimum of two years of experience in traditional healing within the last 10 years.
* Candidate must be able to provide guidance and counseling in accordance with traditional teachings and provide spiritual services and ceremonies.

**Objectives:**
The Traditional Healer Apprentice will assist Indigenous offenders in learning about traditional healing practices, and will provide spiritual services and ceremonies to support their correctional plans.

**Responsibilities:**

* Participation in integrated team meetings and case conferences
* Coordination and supervision of spiritually significant ceremonies and events
* Provision of traditional healing and counseling services
* Education and training of institutional staff on traditional healing practices
* Collaboration with the University of Saskatchewan on research and evaluation of traditional healing practices

**Contract Duration:**
The contract is for a period of five years, from April 1, 2023 to March 31, 2028.

**Estimated Value:**
The estimated value of the contract is $416,496.90 (GST/HST extra).

**Submission Requirements:**
Suppliers who believe they meet the requirements must submit a statement of capabilities no later than February 23, 2023 at 2:00 PM CST to:

Janet Nelson
Regional Procurement Officer
Region Headquarters, Prairies
3427 Faithfull Avenue
SASKATOON, SK S7K 8H6
Telephone: (306) 659-9252
Email: 501contracts@csc-scc.gc.ca

**Note:** This procurement is set-aside for an Indigenous supplier and only qualified Indigenous businesses may submit a statement of capabilities. The contract is not subject to any trade agreements or Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements. The CSC reserves the right to request supplementary information or documentation to support the knowledge and experience claimed.
